Package com.logicea.cardsapp.controller

Class CardController

java.lang.Object
com.logicea.cardsapp.controller.CardController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/cardsapi") @CrossOrigin @Validated public class CardController extends Object
Controller for querying the API for CardDto instances. Supports operations for POST, GET (id and aggreggate), PUT, PATCH and DELETE. Hibernate validators are used to validate the request bodies, where applicable.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • postCard

      @PostMapping("/card") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<CardDto>> postCard(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid CardDto cardDto) throws CardNameNotProvidedException
      POST mapping endpoint for cards.
      Parameters:
      cardDto - The deserialized JSON payload describing the card's parameters.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with appropriate status:
      • HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST and an error message in the case of bad requests.
      • HttpStatus.OK and an updated payload with the original card data enhanced with audit data in the case of successful requests.
      Throws:
      CardNameNotProvidedException - if the user does not supply a card name. We require that new card instances in the API have a card name.

    • getCard

      @GetMapping("/card/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<CardDto>> getCard(@PathVariable Long id)
      Get-by-ID endpoint. Member users that attempt to access cards of other member users or admins cannot do so, and are informed via the return of status code HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the card to look up.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with either an error status code and an error message or HttpStatus.OK and the requested card's payload.

    • aggregateGetCards

      @GetMapping("/card") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.CollectionModel<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<CardDto>>> aggregateGetCards(@RequestParam Map<String,String> filterParams, @RequestParam(name="page",defaultValue="0") @Min(0L) @Min(0L) Integer page, @RequestParam(name="items_in_page",defaultValue="5") @Min(1L) @Min(1L) Integer pageSize, @RequestParam(name="sort_by_field",defaultValue="id") @NonNull @NotBlank @NonNull @NotBlank String sortByField, @RequestParam(name="sort_order",defaultValue="ASC") @NonNull @NonNull SortOrder sortOrder) throws InvalidSortByFieldException
      Aggregate GET endpoint for filtered, paginated and sorted queries for multiple cards.
      Parameters:
      filterParams - A Map describing the possible filters to filter returned cards by. For example, Constants.NAME_FILTER_STRING, Constants.COLOR_FILTER_STRING.
      page - The zero-based index of the page that we want to return, default 0.
      pageSize - The number of records per page to return, default 5.
      sortByField - The field to sort the responses by, default "id"
      sortOrder - The sort order of the results, default SortOrder.ASC.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with HttpStatus.OK and the cards that specify the required criteria, or a combination of appropriate Http error code and error text. Members that attempt to filter by a different member's or an admin's username are returned an error HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN.
      Throws:
      InvalidSortByFieldException - if the user provides an invalid field to sort by. Note that fields need to be provided in camelCase format.

    • putCard

      @PutMapping("/card/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<CardDto>> putCard(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid CardDto cardDto) throws CardNameNotProvidedException
      PUT endpoint for Cards. We follow the traditional semantics of PUT, for full replacement, but for auditing purposes we do not update the creation timestamp. Members that attempt to PUT on an ID that they have not POST-ed receive a HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN error code and an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      id - THe unique ID of the card to replace.
      cardDto - The data of the new card to replace. It should provide a name.
      Returns:
      The updated card and HttpStatus.OK, or a combination of Http error code and error text.
      Throws:
      CardNameNotProvidedException - if the user has not provided a name for the new card.

    • patchCard

      @PatchMapping("/card/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<CardDto>> patchCard(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid CardDto cardDto) throws CardNameCannotBeBlankException
      PATCH endpoint for cards. null or missing entries are ignored. We do not allow the user to clear the name of the card, though. Members that attempt to PATCH on an ID that they have not POST-ed receive a HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN error code and an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      id - THe unique ID of the card to update.
      cardDto - The data of the new card to update.
      Returns:
      The updated card and HttpStatus.OK, or a combination of Http error code and error text.
      Throws:
      CardNameCannotBeBlankException - if the user tries to clear the name of the card by providing a whitespace-only non-null string.

    • deleteCard

      @DeleteMapping("/card/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteCard(@PathVariable Long id)
      DELETE endpoint for cards. We hard-delete cards from the database, for simplicity. Members that attempt to DELETE an ID that they have not POST-ed receive a HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN error code and an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the card to delete. If we cannot find the ID, we choose to send a HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND error code to the user.
      Returns:
      A no-content ResponseEntity if the deletion worked well, otherwise a combination of Http status code and error.
